title: const fn: Missing tracking issue and feature gate name in stability error messages

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-const-fn
labels.description: Area: const fn foo(..) {..}. Pure functions which can be applied at compile time.

body:
In rustc 1.33.0-nightly (a2b0f247b 2018-12-30), compare for example:

```rust
error: function pointers in const fn are unstable
 --> a.rs:1:26
  |
1 | const fn foo(x: fn()) -> fn() { x }
  |                          ^^^^

error: aborting due to previous error
```

… with the error message for some other unstable language feature:

```rust
error[E0658]: box expression syntax is experimental; you can call `Box::new` instead. (see issue #49733)
 --> a.rs:1:24
  |
1 | fn foo() -> Box<u32> { box 4 }
  |                        ^^^^^
  |
  = help: add #![feature(box_syntax)] to the crate attributes to enable

error: aborting due to previous error
```
